lead_paragraph: International experts brought to Mexico to investigate the disappearance of 43 students say they have faced sustained harassment and stonewalling.

byline.original: By AZAM AHMED and PAULINA VILLEGAS

headline.print_headline: Mexico Obstructs Inquiry of Abductions, Panel Says
headline.main: Investigators Say Mexico Has Thwarted Efforts to Solve Students’ Disappearance

snippet: International experts brought to Mexico to investigate the disappearance of 43 students say they have faced sustained harassment and stonewalling.
abstract: International investigators say Mexican government has thwarted human rights efforts to solve case of 43 college students who went missing in September 2014 and are believed to have been abducted by police; remains of only one of 43 students have been found and identified, and rest of remain missing.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
